intro: Gentianopsis yabei f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered gentianopsis, is a rare and striking plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its showy, blue or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. The subspecies albiflora is distinguished by its pale or white petals, making it visually distinct from other gentianopsis species.
